Bill.title: Appropriation - Real Property Transfer Tax for Funding Community College Fund - FY2016-2017 - $9,000,000
sponsors: Campos, Avalos, Yee, Mar and Peskin
Bill.text: Ordinance appropriating a total of $9,000,000 of Real Propery Transfer Tax in FY2016-2017 for funding the COmmunity College Fund to support students attending the City Callege of San Francisco and placing funds on Controller's Reserve pending the outcome of General Funx tax revenue measures in the November 7, 2016, Election.
Bill.question: Question: Shall this Ordinance be FINALLY PASSED?

Bill.title: Consideration of a motion to adjourn as the Boulder City Council and convene as the Central Area General Improvement District (CAGID) Board of Directors; and Consideration of a motion to adopt Resolutions 283, 284 and 285 pertaining to the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder Downtown Commercial District Fund (formerly known as the Central Area General Improvement District Fund); and Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the CAGID Board of Directors and to convene as the University Hill General Improvement District (UHGID) Board of Directors
Bill.text:
AGENDA TITLEAGENDA TITLE: Consideration of a motion to adopt three resolutions pertaining tothe 2018 budget of the City of Boulder Downtown Commercial District Fund(formerly known as the Central Area General Improvement District Fund):
 
1. Resolution 283 concerning the City of Boulder Downtown Commercial District Fund (formerly known as the Central Area General Improvement District Fund), adopting a budget for the fiscal year beginning January 1, 2018; and
 
2. Resolution 284 establishing the 2017 City of Boulder Central Area General Improvement District (CAGID) Property Tax Mill Levy for payment of expenditures, in part, of the District during the 2018 fiscal year, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and
 
3. Resolution 285 appropriating money to defray the expenses and liabilities of the City of Boulder Downtown Commercial District Fund (formerly known as the Central Area General Improvement District Fund) for the 2018 fiscal year and setting forth details in relation thereto; and
 
Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the CAGID Board of Directors and to convene as the University Hill General Improvement District (UHGID) Board of Directors.
Bill.sponsors: PRIMARY STAFF CONTACTRachel Deckert

Bill.title: Consideration of a motion to adopt Resolutions 204, 205 and 206 pertaining to the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder University Hill Commercial District Fund; and consideration of a of a motion to adjourn from the (UHGID) Board of Directors and convene as the Boulder Municipal Property Authority (BMPA) Board of Directors
Bill.text:
AGENDA TITLEAGENDA TITLE: Consideration of a motion to adopt three resolutions pertaining to the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder University Hill Commercial District Fund (formerly known as the University Hill General Improvement District Fund):
1. A resolution concerning the City of Boulder University Hill Commercial District Fund (formerly known as the University Hill General Improvement District Fund), adopting a budget for the fiscal year beginning January 1, 2018; and
 
2. A resolution establishing the 2017 City of Boulder University Hill General
Improvement District (UHGID) Property Tax Mill Levy for payment of
expenditures, in part, of the District during the 2018 fiscal year, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and
 
3. A resolution appropriating money to defray the expenses and liabilities of the City of Boulder University Hill Commercial District Fund (formerly known as the University Hill General Improvement District Fund) for the 2018 fiscal year and setting forth details in relation thereto; and
 
Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the UHGID Board of Directors and convene as the Boulder Municipal Property Authority Board of Directors.
Bill.sponsors: PRIMARY STAFF CONTACTRachel Deckert

Bill.title: Consideration of a motion to adopt Resolution 147  pertaining to the 2018 budget for the Boulder Municipal Property Authority; and Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the Boulder Municipal Property Authority (BPMA) Board of Directors and convene as the Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District Board of Directors
Bill.text:
AGENDA TITLEConsideration of a motion to adopt a resolution pertaining to the
2018 budget for the Boulder Municipal Property Authority; and
 
Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the Boulder Municipal Property Authority (BPMA) Board of Directors and convene as the Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District Board of Directors.
Bill.sponsors: PRIMARY STAFF CONTACTRachel Deckert
Bill.question:
REQUESTED ACTION OR MOTION LANGUAGEStaff requests council consideration of this matter and action in the form of the following motion:
 
Motion to adopt BMPA Resolution 147 adopting the 2018 budget for the Boulder Municipal Property Authority; and 
 
Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the Boulder Municipal Property Authority (BPMA) Board of Directors and convene as the Forest Glen Transit Pass General
Improvement District Board of Directors.

Bill.title: Consideration of motion to adopt Resolutions 56, 57 and 58 pertaining to the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District Fund; and Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District Board of Directors, and convene as the Board of Directors of the Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Travel Demand Management
Bill.text:
AGENDA TITLEConsideration of motion to adopt three resolutions pertaining to
the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General
Improvement District Fund:
 
1. A resolution concerning the City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District, adopting a budget for the fiscal year beginning January 1, 2018; and
 
2. A resolution establishing the 2017 City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District Property Tax Mill Levy for payment of
expenditures, in part, of the District during the 2018 fiscal year, and setting
forth details in relation thereto; and
 
3. A resolution appropriating money to defray the expenses and liabilities of the City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District for the 2018 fiscal year and setting forth details in relation thereto; and
 
Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District Board of Directors, and convene as the Board of Directors of the Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Travel Demand Management.
Bill.sponsors: PRIMARY STAFF CONTACTRachel Deckert
Bill.question:
REQUESTED ACTION OR MOTION LANGUAGEStaff requests council consideration of this matter and action in the form of the following motion:
• Motion to adopt Forest Glen Transit Pass Resolution 56 adopting the 2018
budget for the Forest Glen Transit Pass GID Fund;
• Motion to adopt Forest Glen Transit Pass Resolution 57 establishing the 2017 City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District Property Tax Mill Levy;
• Motion to adopt Forest Glen Transit Pass Resolution 58 appropriating the
2018 budget for the Forest Glen Transit Pass GID Fund; and
 
Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the City of Boulder Forest Glen Transit Pass General Improvement District Board of Directors, and convene as the Board of Directors of the Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Travel Demand Management.

Bill.title: Consideration of a motion to adopt Resolutions 23, 24 and 25 pertaining to the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Travel Demand Management Fund; and Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Travel Demand Management Board of Directors and convene as the Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Parking Board of Directors

AGENDA TITLEConsideration of a motion to adopt three resolutions pertaining to
the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Travel Demand Management Fund:

Commission General Improvement District – Travel Demand Management
Fund, adopting a budget for the fiscal year beginning January 1, 2018; and

during the 2018 fiscal year, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and

Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Travel Demand Management Board of Directors and convene as the Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Parking Board of Directors.
Bill.sponsors: PRIMARY STAFF CONTACTRachel Deckert

Bill.title: Consideration of a motion to adopt Resolutions 23, 24 and 25 pertaining to the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Parking Fund; and Consideration of a motion to adjourn from the Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District - Parking Board of Directors and reconvene as the Boulder City Council
Bill.text:
AGENDA TITLEConsideration of a motion to adopt three resolutions pertaining to
the 2018 budget of the City of Boulder Boulder Junction Access Commission General Improvement District – Parking Fund:

Commission General Improvement District – Parking Fund, adopting a budget for the fiscal year beginning January 1, 2018; and

Bill.title: Introduction, first reading and consideration of a motion to order published by title only Ordinance 8216 amending Chapter 10-12, "Mobile Homes," B.R.C. 1981, by adding new sections creating a right to privacy for mobile home residents, prohibiting retaliation by park owners and requiring mediation of disputes between residents and park owners; and setting forth related details
Bill.text: AGENDA TITLEIntroduction, first reading and consideration of a motion to order published by title only an ordinance amending Chapter 10-12, "Mobile Homes," B.R.C. 1981, by adding new sections creating a right to privacy for mobile home residents, prohibiting retaliation by park owners and requiring mediation of disputes between residents and park owners; and setting forth related details

Bill.title: 1.       Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8210 that adopts a budget for the City of Boulder, Colorado, for the fiscal year commencing on the first day of January 2018 and ending on the last day of December 2018 and setting forth details in relation thereto; and 2.       Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8211 that establishes the 2017 City of Boulder property tax mill levies which are to be collected by the County of Boulder, State of Colorado, within the City of Boulder in 2018 for payment of expenditures by the City of Boulder, County of Boulder, State of Colorado, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and 3.       Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8212 that appropriates money to defray expenses and liabilities of the City of Boulder, Colorado, for the 2018 fiscal year of the City of Boulder, commencing on the first day of January 2018, and ending on the last day of December 2018, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and 4.       Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8213 that amends Section 3-8-3 and Chapter 4-20 of the B.R.C. 1981 changing certain fees, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and 5.       Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8214 amending Section 11-1-3 and Section 11-2-31 of the B.R.C. 1981, related to City Manager Rules regarding Wastewater, Storm Water and Flood Management Fees, and setting forth related details
Bill.text:
AGENDA TITLEConsideration of the following five items relating to the 2018 Budget:
 
1. Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8210 adopting a budget for the City of Boulder, Colorado, for the fiscal year
commencing on the first day of January 2018 and ending on the last day of
December 2018, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and
 
2. Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8211
establishing the 2017 City of Boulder Property Tax Mill Levies 
to be collected by the County of Boulder, State of Colorado, within the City of Boulder in 2018 for payment of expenditures by the City of Boulder, Countyof Boulder, State of Colorado, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and
 
3. Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8212 appropriating money to defray expenses and liabilities of the City of
Boulder, Colorado, for the 2018 fiscal year of the City of Boulder,
commencing on the first day of January 2018, and ending on the last day of
December 2018, and setting forth details in relation thereto; and
 
4. Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8213 amending Section 3-8-3 and Chapter 4-20 of the B.R.C. 1981 changing
certain fees, and setting forth related details; and
 
5. Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8214 amending Section 11-1-3 and Section 11-2-31 of the B.R.C 1981, related to City Manager Rules regarding Wastewater, Storm Water and Flood Management Fees, and setting forth related details.
Bill.sponsors: PRIMARY STAFF CONTACTKady Doelling

Bill.title: Continuation of Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8206 annexing the Hogan Pancost properites, 5399 Kewanee Dr. and 5967 South Boulder Road, including adjacent rights-of way with an initial zoning classification of Residential Low – 2 (RL-2); and Council comment on Concept Plan and Review
Bill.text:
AGENDA TITLEItems related to the proposed annexation of the Boulder County properties identified as 5399 Kewanee Drive and 5697 South Boulder Road commonly referred to as the Hogan-Pancost site (LUR2015-00093):
 

    
    Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8206 annexing the subject properties including adjacent rights-of-way with an initial zoning classification of Residential Low – 2 (RL-2), and
     
    
    
    City Council comment on the Concept Plan and Review (LUR2016-00076) application proposing construction of 117 attached and detached residential units (50 percent as permanently affordable units) served by new public rights-of-ways and alleys on the properties and including the preservation of the east parcel and portions of the west parcel pursuant to the annexation agreement.
Bill.sponsors: PRIMARY STAFF CONTACTKarl Guiler, Senior Planner/ Code Amendment Specialist
Bill.question:
REQUESTED ACTION OR MOTION LANGUAGEItems related to the proposed annexation of the Boulder County properties identified as 5399 Kewanee Drive and 5697 South Boulder Road commonly referred to as the Hogan-Pancost site (LUR2015-00093):
 

    
    Second reading and consideration of a motion to adopt Ordinance 8206 annexing the subject properties including adjacent rights-of-way with an initial zoning classification of Residential Low – 2 (RL-2), and
     
    
    
    City Council comment on the Concept Plan and Review (LUR2016-00076) application proposing construction of 117 attached and detached residential units (50 percent as permanently affordable units) served by new public rights-of-ways and alleys on the properties and including the preservation of the east parcel and portions of the west parcel pursuant to the annexation agreement.
